intro: Sison gussonei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Sison gussonei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
